Where the court confirmed that the delay fine is only due if the project is fully implemented with a delay in delivery, but in the case of a fundamental breach of implementation, whether by not completing the works or implementing only part of it, there is no place for the delay fine, but compensation is the legal solution, provided that the actual damage is proven.The court relied on Articles 272 and 389 of the UAE Civil Transactions Law, where the first requires damage to be achieved for the entitlement to compensation, while the second gives the court discretion to estimate its value according to the actual damage to the employer.This principle reinforces the contractual balance between the contracting parties, as it prevents the imposition of unjustified obligations on the contractor, while ensuring the protection of the employer's rights to compensation for damages caused to him as a result of a fundamental breach of execution.

Where the court confirmed that the delay fine is only due if the project is fully implemented with a delay in delivery, but in the case of a fundamental breach of implementation, whether by not completing the works or implementing only part of it, there is no place for the delay fine, but compensation is the legal solution, provided that the actual damage is proven.The court relied on Articles 272 and 389 of the UAE Civil Transactions Law, where the first requires damage to be achieved for the entitlement to compensation, while the second gives the court discretion to estimate its value according to the actual damage to the employer.This principle reinforces the contractual balance between the contracting parties, as it prevents the imposition of unjustified obligations on the contractor, while ensuring the protection of the employer's rights to compensation for damages caused to him as a result of a fundamental breach of execution.

Where the court confirmed that the delay fine is only due if the project is fully implemented with a delay in delivery, but in the case of a fundamental breach of implementation, whether by not completing the works or implementing only part of it, there is no place for the delay fine, but compensation is the legal solution, provided that the actual damage is proven.The court relied on Articles 272 and 389 of the UAE Civil Transactions Law, where the first requires damage to be achieved for the entitlement to compensation, while the second gives the court discretion to estimate its value according to the actual damage to the employer.This principle reinforces the contractual balance between the contracting parties, as it prevents the imposition of unjustified obligations on the contractor, while ensuring the protection of the employer's rights to compensation for damages caused to him as a result of a fundamental breach of execution.

Where the court confirmed that the delay fine is only due if the project is fully implemented with a delay in delivery, but in the case of a fundamental breach of implementation, whether by not completing the works or implementing only part of it, there is no place for the delay fine, but compensation is the legal solution, provided that the actual damage is proven.The court relied on Articles 272 and 389 of the UAE Civil Transactions Law, where the first requires damage to be achieved for the entitlement to compensation, while the second gives the court discretion to estimate its value according to the actual damage to the employer.This principle reinforces the contractual balance between the contracting parties, as it prevents the imposition of unjustified obligations on the contractor, while ensuring the protection of the employer's rights to compensation for damages caused to him as a result of a fundamental breach of execution.

Where the court confirmed that the delay fine is only due if the project is fully implemented with a delay in delivery, but in the case of a fundamental breach of implementation, whether by not completing the works or implementing only part of it, there is no place for the delay fine, but compensation is the legal solution, provided that the actual damage is proven.The court relied on Articles 272 and 389 of the UAE Civil Transactions Law, where the first requires damage to be achieved for the entitlement to compensation, while the second gives the court discretion to estimate its value according to the actual damage to the employer.This principle reinforces the contractual balance between the contracting parties, as it prevents the imposition of unjustified obligations on the contractor, while ensuring the protection of the employer's rights to compensation for damages caused to him as a result of a fundamental breach of execution.

Where the court confirmed that the delay fine is only due if the project is fully implemented with a delay in delivery, but in the case of a fundamental breach of implementation, whether by not completing the works or implementing only part of it, there is no place for the delay fine, but compensation is the legal solution, provided that the actual damage is proven.The court relied on Articles 272 and 389 of the UAE Civil Transactions Law, where the first requires damage to be achieved for the entitlement to compensation, while the second gives the court discretion to estimate its value according to the actual damage to the employer.This principle reinforces the contractual balance between the contracting parties, as it prevents the imposition of unjustified obligations on the contractor, while ensuring the protection of the employer's rights to compensation for damages caused to him as a result of a fundamental breach of execution.

Where the court confirmed that the delay fine is only due if the project is fully implemented with a delay in delivery, but in the case of a fundamental breach of implementation, whether by not completing the works or implementing only part of it, there is no place for the delay fine, but compensation is the legal solution, provided that the actual damage is proven.The court relied on Articles 272 and 389 of the UAE Civil Transactions Law, where the first requires damage to be achieved for the entitlement to compensation, while the second gives the court discretion to estimate its value according to the actual damage to the employer.This principle reinforces the contractual balance between the contracting parties, as it prevents the imposition of unjustified obligations on the contractor, while ensuring the protection of the employer's rights to compensation for damages caused to him as a result of a fundamental breach of execution.

Where Does $1M Go the Furthest in Your Real Estate Investment Career?ğŸ’°When it comes to global cities, Dubai stands out for offering the most space for your money. Here's a quick comparison of how much space you get in top-tier cities as you can see in the shared Graph ( Dubai Stand Out ) .ğŸ“ Dubai â€“ 1,130 sq. ft. ğŸš€That's 3x-6x more space than in major global financial hubs! Letâ€™s dive into Off-Plan vs Secondary investments.ğŸ—ï¸ Off-Plan (New Developments):ğŸ’° Lock in todayâ€™s price with flexible payment plans.ğŸ“ˆ Property appreciates by 30-40% by handover (usually 3 years).ğŸ“† After completion, it appreciates 7-10% annually.ğŸ’µ Start earning 7-8% rental yield once the property is ready.ğŸ¡ Secondary Market (Ready Properties):ğŸ’µ Immediate rental income (7% annual yield).ğŸ“‰ More stable, but lower capital appreciation (5-7% per year).ğŸ’¸ Higher upfront costs and possible maintenance expenses.ğŸ’¡ A Working Example: Off-Plan vs Secondary Scenario 1: Off-Plan Investment ($1M)âœ… $600K paid over 3 years (60% during construction).ğŸ’¥ Property value increases to $1.35M (35% rise) by completion.âœ… Final $400K payment upon handover.ğŸ“ˆ Post-handover, property appreciates 7-10% annually.After 7 years:ğŸ“Š Property Value: ~$1.9M - $2.3MğŸ’µ Total Rental Income (Years 4-7): ~$400KğŸ’¥ Total Value: $2.3M - $2.7M (2.3x-2.7x return) Scenario 2: Secondary Market ($1M Ready Property)âœ… 100% upfront payment.ğŸ’¸ Start earning $70K per year in rental income (7%).ğŸ“ˆ Property appreciates at 5-7% annually.After 7 years:ğŸ“Š Property Value: ~$1.4M - $1.6MğŸ’µ Total Rental Income: ~$490KğŸ’¥ Total Value: $1.9M - $2.1M (1.9x-2.1x return)ğŸ“Œ Key Takeaways:ğŸ”‘ Off-Plan requires less upfront capital (only 60% during construction).ğŸ“ˆ Off-Plan offers higher capital growth in the long run (up to 2.7x return vs 2.1x).ğŸ¡ Secondary provides immediate cash flow but lower appreciation.ğŸš€ The Winner?The Off-Plan investment grows faster, needs less upfront capital, and provides a higher-value asset once completed. Where the court confirmed that the delay fine is only due if the project is fully implemented with a delay in delivery, but in the case of a fundamental breach of implementation, whether by not completing the works or implementing only part of it, there is no place for the delay fine, but compensation is the legal solution, provided that the actual damage is proven.The court relied on Articles 272 and 389 of the UAE Civil Transactions Law, where the first requires damage to be achieved for the entitlement to compensation, while the second gives the court discretion to estimate its value according to the actual damage to the employer.This principle reinforces the contractual balance between the contracting parties, as it prevents the imposition of unjustified obligations on the contractor, while ensuring the protection of the employer's rights to compensation for damages caused to him as a result of a fundamental breach of execution.

Where Does $1M Go the Furthest in Your Real Estate Investment Career?ğŸ’°When it comes to global cities, Dubai stands out for offering the most space for your money. Here's a quick comparison of how much space you get in top-tier cities as you can see in the shared Graph ( Dubai Stand Out ) .ğŸ“ Dubai â€“ 1,130 sq. ft. ğŸš€That's 3x-6x more space than in major global financial hubs! But in Dubai, where you invest matters just as much as the space you get. Letâ€™s dive into Off-Plan vs Secondary investments.ğŸ—ï¸ Off-Plan (New Developments):ğŸ’° Lock in todayâ€™s price with flexible payment plans.ğŸ“ˆ Property appreciates by 30-40% by handover (usually 3 years).ğŸ“† After completion, it appreciates 7-10% annually.ğŸ’µ Start earning 7-8% rental yield once the property is ready.ğŸ¡ Secondary Market (Ready Properties):ğŸ’µ Immediate rental income (7% annual yield).ğŸ“‰ More stable, but lower capital appreciation (5-7% per year).ğŸ’¸ Higher upfront costs and possible maintenance expenses.ğŸ’¡ A Working Example: Off-Plan vs Secondary Scenario 1: Off-Plan Investment ($1M)âœ… $600K paid over 3 years (60% during construction).ğŸ’¥ Property value increases to $1.35M (35% rise) by completion.âœ… Final $400K payment upon handover.ğŸ“ˆ Post-handover, property appreciates 7-10% annually.After 7 years:ğŸ“Š Property Value: ~$1.9M - $2.3MğŸ’µ Total Rental Income (Years 4-7): ~$400KğŸ’¥ Total Value: $2.3M - $2.7M (2.3x-2.7x return) Scenario 2: Secondary Market ($1M Ready Property)âœ… 100% upfront payment.ğŸ’¸ Start earning $70K per year in rental income (7%).ğŸ“ˆ Property appreciates at 5-7% annually.After 7 years:ğŸ“Š Property Value: ~$1.4M - $1.6MğŸ’µ Total Rental Income: ~$490KğŸ’¥ Total Value: $1.9M - $2.1M (1.9x-2.1x return)ğŸ“Œ Key Takeaways:ğŸ”‘ Off-Plan requires less upfront capital (only 60% during construction).ğŸ“ˆ Off-Plan offers higher capital growth in the long run (up to 2.7x return vs 2.1x).ğŸ¡ Secondary provides immediate cash flow but lower appreciation.ğŸš€ The Winner?The Off-Plan investment grows faster, needs less upfront capital, and provides a higher-value asset once completed. Still not sure? Dubai Financial Services Authority Launches Tokenization RegulatoryDubai will always be known for its ability to adapt and adopt great innovations to enable them to move forward.And if you ask me, I'd say they made the right choice giving tokenization a chance to change things around the real estate industry in Dubai.Having experience working with a few real estate professionals in Dubai, I know this will go a long way for them.The Dubai Land Department (DLD) just launched a Real Estate Tokenization Pilot Program, making it the first real estate registry department in the Middle East to regulate ownership titles on a blockchain.By 2033, DLD expects tokenized real estate to account for 7% of all property transactions in Dubai â€” thatâ€™s 60 billion dirhams ($16B) in tokenized property deals.This move isnâ€™t just about tokenization, itâ€™s about unlocking new market opportunities: âœ… Lower barriers to entry for investors âœ… Increased liquidity and faster settlements âœ… Transparent ownership backed by blockchainUnlike traditional real estate models, tokenization creates a structured ownership system â€” giving investors more control and security.Marwan Ahmed Bin Ghalita, Director General of DLD, put it perfectly: "This initiative will simplify and enhance buying, selling, and investment processes."Dubai is once again showing why itâ€™s a global leader in innovation. If youâ€™re in the real estate or RWA space, this is your signal the future is already here.Whatâ€™s your take on this? Are we about to see a major shift in real estate investment? ğŸ‘‡if you enjoy this post; like, comment, and share to spread the word!

Where the court confirmed that the delay fine is only due if the project is fully implemented with a delay in delivery, but in the case of a fundamental breach of implementation, whether by not completing the works or implementing only part of it, there is no place for the delay fine, but compensation is the legal solution, provided that the actual damage is proven.The court relied on Articles 272 and 389 of the UAE Civil Transactions Law, where the first requires damage to be achieved for the entitlement to compensation, while the second gives the court discretion to estimate its value according to the actual damage to the employer.This principle reinforces the contractual balance between the contracting parties, as it prevents the imposition of unjustified obligations on the contractor, while ensuring the protection of the employer's rights to compensation for damages caused to him as a result of a fundamental breach of execution.

Letâ€™s dive into Off-Plan vs Secondary investments.ğŸ—ï¸ Off-Plan (New Developments):ğŸ’° Lock in todayâ€™s price with flexible payment plans.ğŸ“ˆ Property appreciates by 30-40% by handover (usually 3 years).ğŸ“† After completion, it appreciates 7-10% annually.ğŸ’µ Start earning 7-8% rental yield once the property is ready.ğŸ¡ Secondary Market (Ready Properties):ğŸ’µ Immediate rental income (7% annual yield).ğŸ“‰ More stable, but lower capital appreciation (5-7% per year).ğŸ’¸ Higher upfront costs and possible maintenance expenses.ğŸ’¡ A Working Example: Off-Plan vs Secondary Scenario 1: Off-Plan Investment ($1M)âœ… $600K paid over 3 years (60% during construction).ğŸ’¥ Property value increases to $1.35M (35% rise) by completion.âœ… Final $400K payment upon handover.ğŸ“ˆ Post-handover, property appreciates 7-10% annually.After 7 years:ğŸ“Š Property Value: ~$1.9M - $2.3MğŸ’µ Total Rental Income (Years 4-7): ~$400KğŸ’¥ Total Value: $2.3M - $2.7M (2.3x-2.7x return) Scenario 2: Secondary Market ($1M Ready Property)âœ… 100% upfront payment.ğŸ’¸ Start earning $70K per year in rental income (7%).ğŸ“ˆ Property appreciates at 5-7% annually.After 7 years:ğŸ“Š Property Value: ~$1.4M - $1.6MğŸ’µ Total Rental Income: ~$490KğŸ’¥ Total Value: $1.9M - $2.1M (1.9x-2.1x return)ğŸ“Œ Key Takeaways:ğŸ”‘ Off-Plan requires less upfront capital (only 60% during construction).ğŸ“ˆ Off-Plan offers higher capital growth in the long run (up to 2.7x return vs 2.1x).ğŸ¡ Secondary provides immediate cash flow but lower appreciation.ğŸš€ The Winner?The Off-Plan investment grows faster, needs less upfront capital, and provides a higher-value asset once completed. Dubai Financial Services Authority Launches Tokenization RegulatoryDubai will always be known for its ability to adapt and adopt great innovations to enable them to move forward.And if you ask me, I'd say they made the right choice giving tokenization a chance to change things around the real estate industry in Dubai.Having experience working with a few real estate professionals in Dubai, I know this will go a long way for them.The Dubai Land Department (DLD) just launched a Real Estate Tokenization Pilot Program, making it the first real estate registry department in the Middle East to regulate ownership titles on a blockchain.By 2033, DLD expects tokenized real estate to account for 7% of all property transactions in Dubai â€” thatâ€™s 60 billion dirhams ($16B) in tokenized property deals.This move isnâ€™t just about tokenization, itâ€™s about unlocking new market opportunities: âœ… Lower barriers to entry for investors âœ… Increased liquidity and faster settlements âœ… Transparent ownership backed by blockchainUnlike traditional real estate models, tokenization creates a structured ownership system â€” giving investors more control and security.Marwan Ahmed Bin Ghalita, Director General of DLD, put it perfectly: "This initiative will simplify and enhance buying, selling, and investment processes."Dubai is once again showing why itâ€™s a global leader in innovation. If youâ€™re in the real estate or RWA space, this is your signal the future is already here.Whatâ€™s your take on this? Are we about to see a major shift in real estate investment? ğŸ‘‡if you enjoy this post; like, comment, and share to spread the word!

Where the court confirmed that the delay fine is only due if the project is fully implemented with a delay in delivery, but in the case of a fundamental breach of implementation, whether by not completing the works or implementing only part of it, there is no place for the delay fine, but compensation is the legal solution, provided that the actual damage is proven.The court relied on Articles 272 and 389 of the UAE Civil Transactions Law, where the first requires damage to be achieved for the entitlement to compensation, while the second gives the court discretion to estimate its value according to the actual damage to the employer.This principle reinforces the contractual balance between the contracting parties, as it prevents the imposition of unjustified obligations on the contractor, while ensuring the protection of the employer's rights to compensation for damages caused to him as a result of a fundamental breach of execution.

Letâ€™s dive into Off-Plan vs Secondary investments.ğŸ—ï¸ Off-Plan (New Developments):ğŸ’° Lock in todayâ€™s price with flexible payment plans.ğŸ“ˆ Property appreciates by 30-40% by handover (usually 3 years).ğŸ“† After completion, it appreciates 7-10% annually.ğŸ’µ Start earning 7-8% rental yield once the property is ready.ğŸ¡ Secondary Market (Ready Properties):ğŸ’µ Immediate rental income (7% annual yield).ğŸ“‰ More stable, but lower capital appreciation (5-7% per year).ğŸ’¸ Higher upfront costs and possible maintenance expenses.ğŸ’¡ A Working Example: Off-Plan vs Secondary Scenario 1: Off-Plan Investment ($1M)âœ… $600K paid over 3 years (60% during construction).ğŸ’¥ Property value increases to $1.35M (35% rise) by completion.âœ… Final $400K payment upon handover.ğŸ“ˆ Post-handover, property appreciates 7-10% annually.After 7 years:ğŸ“Š Property Value: ~$1.9M - $2.3MğŸ’µ Total Rental Income (Years 4-7): ~$400KğŸ’¥ Total Value: $2.3M - $2.7M (2.3x-2.7x return) Scenario 2: Secondary Market ($1M Ready Property)âœ… 100% upfront payment.ğŸ’¸ Start earning $70K per year in rental income (7%).ğŸ“ˆ Property appreciates at 5-7% annually.After 7 years:ğŸ“Š Property Value: ~$1.4M - $1.6MğŸ’µ Total Rental Income: ~$490KğŸ’¥ Total Value: $1.9M - $2.1M (1.9x-2.1x return)ğŸ“Œ Key Takeaways:ğŸ”‘ Off-Plan requires less upfront capital (only 60% during construction).ğŸ“ˆ Off-Plan offers higher capital growth in the long run (up to 2.7x return vs 2.1x).ğŸ¡ Secondary provides immediate cash flow but lower appreciation.ğŸš€ The Winner?The Off-Plan investment grows faster, needs less upfront capital, and provides a higher-value asset once completed. Dubai Financial Services Authority Launches Tokenization RegulatoryDubai will always be known for its ability to adapt and adopt great innovations to enable them to move forward.And if you ask me, I'd say they made the right choice giving tokenization a chance to change things around the real estate industry in Dubai.Having experience working with a few real estate professionals in Dubai, I know this will go a long way for them.The Dubai Land Department (DLD) just launched a Real Estate Tokenization Pilot Program, making it the first real estate registry department in the Middle East to regulate ownership titles on a blockchain.By 2033, DLD expects tokenized real estate to account for 7% of all property transactions in Dubai â€” thatâ€™s 60 billion dirhams ($16B) in tokenized property deals.This move isnâ€™t just about tokenization, itâ€™s about unlocking new market opportunities: âœ… Lower barriers to entry for investors âœ… Increased liquidity and faster settlements âœ… Transparent ownership backed by blockchainUnlike traditional real estate models, tokenization creates a structured ownership system â€” giving investors more control and security.Marwan Ahmed Bin Ghalita, Director General of DLD, put it perfectly: "This initiative will simplify and enhance buying, selling, and investment processes."Dubai is once again showing why itâ€™s a global leader in innovation. If youâ€™re in the real estate or RWA space, this is your signal the future is already here.Whatâ€™s your take on this? Are we about to see a major shift in real estate investment? ğŸ‘‡if you enjoy this post; like, comment, and share to spread the word!

Where the court confirmed that the delay fine is only due if the project is fully implemented with a delay in delivery, but in the case of a fundamental breach of implementation, whether by not completing the works or implementing only part of it, there is no place for the delay fine, but compensation is the legal solution, provided that the actual damage is proven.The court relied on Articles 272 and 389 of the UAE Civil Transactions Law, where the first requires damage to be achieved for the entitlement to compensation, while the second gives the court discretion to estimate its value according to the actual damage to the employer.This principle reinforces the contractual balance between the contracting parties, as it prevents the imposition of unjustified obligations on the contractor, while ensuring the protection of the employer's rights to compensation for damages caused to him as a result of a fundamental breach of execution.

If youâ€™re in the real estate or RWA space, this is your signal the future is already here.Whatâ€™s your take on this? Where the court confirmed that the delay fine is only due if the project is fully implemented with a delay in delivery, but in the case of a fundamental breach of implementation, whether by not completing the works or implementing only part of it, there is no place for the delay fine, but compensation is the legal solution, provided that the actual damage is proven.The court relied on Articles 272 and 389 of the UAE Civil Transactions Law, where the first requires damage to be achieved for the entitlement to compensation, while the second gives the court discretion to estimate its value according to the actual damage to the employer.This principle reinforces the contractual balance between the contracting parties, as it prevents the imposition of unjustified obligations on the contractor, while ensuring the protection of the employer's rights to compensation for damages caused to him as a result of a fundamental breach of execution.

Where the court confirmed that the delay fine is only due if the project is fully implemented with a delay in delivery, but in the case of a fundamental breach of implementation, whether by not completing the works or implementing only part of it, there is no place for the delay fine, but compensation is the legal solution, provided that the actual damage is proven.The court relied on Articles 272 and 389 of the UAE Civil Transactions Law, where the first requires damage to be achieved for the entitlement to compensation, while the second gives the court discretion to estimate its value according to the actual damage to the employer.This principle reinforces the contractual balance between the contracting parties, as it prevents the imposition of unjustified obligations on the contractor, while ensuring the protection of the employer's rights to compensation for damages caused to him as a result of a fundamental breach of execution.

Letâ€™s dive into Off-Plan vs Secondary investments.ğŸ—ï¸ Off-Plan (New Developments):ğŸ’° Lock in todayâ€™s price with flexible payment plans.ğŸ“ˆ Property appreciates by 30-40% by handover (usually 3 years).ğŸ“† After completion, it appreciates 7-10% annually.ğŸ’µ Start earning 7-8% rental yield once the property is ready.ğŸ¡ Secondary Market (Ready Properties):ğŸ’µ Immediate rental income (7% annual yield).ğŸ“‰ More stable, but lower capital appreciation (5-7% per year).ğŸ’¸ Higher upfront costs and possible maintenance expenses.ğŸ’¡ A Working Example: Off-Plan vs Secondary Scenario 1: Off-Plan Investment ($1M)âœ… $600K paid over 3 years (60% during construction).ğŸ’¥ Property value increases to $1.35M (35% rise) by completion.âœ… Final $400K payment upon handover.ğŸ“ˆ Post-handover, property appreciates 7-10% annually.After 7 years:ğŸ“Š Property Value: ~$1.9M - $2.3MğŸ’µ Total Rental Income (Years 4-7): ~$400KğŸ’¥ Total Value: $2.3M - $2.7M (2.3x-2.7x return) Scenario 2: Secondary Market ($1M Ready Property)âœ… 100% upfront payment.ğŸ’¸ Start earning $70K per year in rental income (7%).ğŸ“ˆ Property appreciates at 5-7% annually.After 7 years:ğŸ“Š Property Value: ~$1.4M - $1.6MğŸ’µ Total Rental Income: ~$490KğŸ’¥ Total Value: $1.9M - $2.1M (1.9x-2.1x return)ğŸ“Œ Key Takeaways:ğŸ”‘ Off-Plan requires less upfront capital (only 60% during construction).ğŸ“ˆ Off-Plan offers higher capital growth in the long run (up to 2.7x return vs 2.1x).ğŸ¡ Secondary provides immediate cash flow but lower appreciation.ğŸš€ The Winner?The Off-Plan investment grows faster, needs less upfront capital, and provides a higher-value asset once completed. Still not sure? Dubai Financial Services Authority Launches Tokenization RegulatoryDubai will always be known for its ability to adapt and adopt great innovations to enable them to move forward.And if you ask me, I'd say they made the right choice giving tokenization a chance to change things around the real estate industry in Dubai.Having experience working with a few real estate professionals in Dubai, I know this will go a long way for them.The Dubai Land Department (DLD) just launched a Real Estate Tokenization Pilot Program, making it the first real estate registry department in the Middle East to regulate ownership titles on a blockchain.By 2033, DLD expects tokenized real estate to account for 7% of all property transactions in Dubai â€” thatâ€™s 60 billion dirhams ($16B) in tokenized property deals.This move isnâ€™t just about tokenization, itâ€™s about unlocking new market opportunities: âœ… Lower barriers to entry for investors âœ… Increased liquidity and faster settlements âœ… Transparent ownership backed by blockchainUnlike traditional real estate models, tokenization creates a structured ownership system â€” giving investors more control and security.Marwan Ahmed Bin Ghalita, Director General of DLD, put it perfectly: "This initiative will simplify and enhance buying, selling, and investment processes."Dubai is once again showing why itâ€™s a global leader in innovation. If youâ€™re in the real estate or RWA space, this is your signal the future is already here.Whatâ€™s your take on this? Are we about to see a major shift in real estate investment? ğŸ‘‡if you enjoy this post; like, comment, and share to spread the word!

Where the court confirmed that the delay fine is only due if the project is fully implemented with a delay in delivery, but in the case of a fundamental breach of implementation, whether by not completing the works or implementing only part of it, there is no place for the delay fine, but compensation is the legal solution, provided that the actual damage is proven.The court relied on Articles 272 and 389 of the UAE Civil Transactions Law, where the first requires damage to be achieved for the entitlement to compensation, while the second gives the court discretion to estimate its value according to the actual damage to the employer.This principle reinforces the contractual balance between the contracting parties, as it prevents the imposition of unjustified obligations on the contractor, while ensuring the protection of the employer's rights to compensation for damages caused to him as a result of a fundamental breach of execution.

Letâ€™s dive into Off-Plan vs Secondary investments.ğŸ—ï¸ Off-Plan (New Developments):ğŸ’° Lock in todayâ€™s price with flexible payment plans.ğŸ“ˆ Property appreciates by 30-40% by handover (usually 3 years).ğŸ“† After completion, it appreciates 7-10% annually.ğŸ’µ Start earning 7-8% rental yield once the property is ready.ğŸ¡ Secondary Market (Ready Properties):ğŸ’µ Immediate rental income (7% annual yield).ğŸ“‰ More stable, but lower capital appreciation (5-7% per year).ğŸ’¸ Higher upfront costs and possible maintenance expenses.ğŸ’¡ A Working Example: Off-Plan vs Secondary Scenario 1: Off-Plan Investment ($1M)âœ… $600K paid over 3 years (60% during construction).ğŸ’¥ Property value increases to $1.35M (35% rise) by completion.âœ… Final $400K payment upon handover.ğŸ“ˆ Post-handover, property appreciates 7-10% annually.After 7 years:ğŸ“Š Property Value: ~$1.9M - $2.3MğŸ’µ Total Rental Income (Years 4-7): ~$400KğŸ’¥ Total Value: $2.3M - $2.7M (2.3x-2.7x return) Scenario 2: Secondary Market ($1M Ready Property)âœ… 100% upfront payment.ğŸ’¸ Start earning $70K per year in rental income (7%).ğŸ“ˆ Property appreciates at 5-7% annually.After 7 years:ğŸ“Š Property Value: ~$1.4M - $1.6MğŸ’µ Total Rental Income: ~$490KğŸ’¥ Total Value: $1.9M - $2.1M (1.9x-2.1x return)ğŸ“Œ Key Takeaways:ğŸ”‘ Off-Plan requires less upfront capital (only 60% during construction).ğŸ“ˆ Off-Plan offers higher capital growth in the long run (up to 2.7x return vs 2.1x).ğŸ¡ Secondary provides immediate cash flow but lower appreciation.ğŸš€ The Winner?The Off-Plan investment grows faster, needs less upfront capital, and provides a higher-value asset once completed. Dubai Financial Services Authority Launches Tokenization RegulatoryDubai will always be known for its ability to adapt and adopt great innovations to enable them to move forward.And if you ask me, I'd say they made the right choice giving tokenization a chance to change things around the real estate industry in Dubai.Having experience working with a few real estate professionals in Dubai, I know this will go a long way for them.The Dubai Land Department (DLD) just launched a Real Estate Tokenization Pilot Program, making it the first real estate registry department in the Middle East to regulate ownership titles on a blockchain.By 2033, DLD expects tokenized real estate to account for 7% of all property transactions in Dubai â€” thatâ€™s 60 billion dirhams ($16B) in tokenized property deals.This move isnâ€™t just about tokenization, itâ€™s about unlocking new market opportunities: âœ… Lower barriers to entry for investors âœ… Increased liquidity and faster settlements âœ… Transparent ownership backed by blockchainUnlike traditional real estate models, tokenization creates a structured ownership system â€” giving investors more control and security.Marwan Ahmed Bin Ghalita, Director General of DLD, put it perfectly: "This initiative will simplify and enhance buying, selling, and investment processes."Dubai is once again showing why itâ€™s a global leader in innovation. If youâ€™re in the real estate or RWA space, this is your signal the future is already here.Whatâ€™s your take on this? Are we about to see a major shift in real estate investment? ğŸ‘‡if you enjoy this post; like, comment, and share to spread the word!

Where the court confirmed that the delay fine is only due if the project is fully implemented with a delay in delivery, but in the case of a fundamental breach of implementation, whether by not completing the works or implementing only part of it, there is no place for the delay fine, but compensation is the legal solution, provided that the actual damage is proven.The court relied on Articles 272 and 389 of the UAE Civil Transactions Law, where the first requires damage to be achieved for the entitlement to compensation, while the second gives the court discretion to estimate its value according to the actual damage to the employer.This principle reinforces the contractual balance between the contracting parties, as it prevents the imposition of unjustified obligations on the contractor, while ensuring the protection of the employer's rights to compensation for damages caused to him as a result of a fundamental breach of execution.

If youâ€™re in the real estate or RWA space, this is your signal the future is already here.Whatâ€™s your take on this? Why are Indian millionaires leaving the country for places like the UAE and Singapore? It's a growing trend that needs attention.High taxes, complex regulations, and the lure of a better lifestyle are just a few reasons. Even the sons and relatives of politicians are making similar moves. Countries like the UAE offer tax-friendly policies and a seamless business environment, making relocation an easy choice.But when wealthy individuals leave, it impacts India's economy. Their investments, job creation, and contributions to the GDP are invaluable.Losing this capital affects our growth and innovation.The government should consider simplifying tax policies, improving business conditions, and enhancing the quality of life to retain talent and wealth.What are your thoughts?

Where the court confirmed that the delay fine is only due if the project is fully implemented with a delay in delivery, but in the case of a fundamental breach of implementation, whether by not completing the works or implementing only part of it, there is no place for the delay fine, but compensation is the legal solution, provided that the actual damage is proven.The court relied on Articles 272 and 389 of the UAE Civil Transactions Law, where the first requires damage to be achieved for the entitlement to compensation, while the second gives the court discretion to estimate its value according to the actual damage to the employer.This principle reinforces the contractual balance between the contracting parties, as it prevents the imposition of unjustified obligations on the contractor, while ensuring the protection of the employer's rights to compensation for damages caused to him as a result of a fundamental breach of execution.

If youâ€™re in the real estate or RWA space, this is your signal the future is already here.Whatâ€™s your take on this? Why are Indian millionaires leaving the country for places like the UAE and Singapore? It's a growing trend that needs attention.High taxes, complex regulations, and the lure of a better lifestyle are just a few reasons. Even the sons and relatives of politicians are making similar moves. Countries like the UAE offer tax-friendly policies and a seamless business environment, making relocation an easy choice.But when wealthy individuals leave, it impacts India's economy. Their investments, job creation, and contributions to the GDP are invaluable.Losing this capital affects our growth and innovation.The government should consider simplifying tax policies, improving business conditions, and enhancing the quality of life to retain talent and wealth.What are your thoughts?

Where the court confirmed that the delay fine is only due if the project is fully implemented with a delay in delivery, but in the case of a fundamental breach of implementation, whether by not completing the works or implementing only part of it, there is no place for the delay fine, but compensation is the legal solution, provided that the actual damage is proven.The court relied on Articles 272 and 389 of the UAE Civil Transactions Law, where the first requires damage to be achieved for the entitlement to compensation, while the second gives the court discretion to estimate its value according to the actual damage to the employer.This principle reinforces the contractual balance between the contracting parties, as it prevents the imposition of unjustified obligations on the contractor, while ensuring the protection of the employer's rights to compensation for damages caused to him as a result of a fundamental breach of execution.

If youâ€™re in the real estate or RWA space, this is your signal the future is already here.Whatâ€™s your take on this? Why are Indian millionaires leaving the country for places like the UAE and Singapore? It's a growing trend that needs attention.High taxes, complex regulations, and the lure of a better lifestyle are just a few reasons. Even the sons and relatives of politicians are making similar moves. Countries like the UAE offer tax-friendly policies and a seamless business environment, making relocation an easy choice.But when wealthy individuals leave, it impacts India's economy. Their investments, job creation, and contributions to the GDP are invaluable.Losing this capital affects our growth and innovation.The government should consider simplifying tax policies, improving business conditions, and enhancing the quality of life to retain talent and wealth.What are your thoughts?

SCAM ALERT ! PW (PhysicsWallah) Alakh Panday Alakh Pandey (PhysicsWallah) Alakh Pandey Scam alert ! Scam alert! Rigged Hiring ! Rigged HiringPW (PhysicsWallah) PW (PhysicsWallah) Physichswallah's hiring process is a fraud. Please don't waste your time applying for jobs here. The hiring at Physics Wallah is riggedâ€”no matter how talented you are or how strong your past work experience is, you wonâ€™t get the job. Jobs are only given to HR's relatives and acquaintances.In the past six months, I have applied for various job positions that perfectly matched my expertise. Yet, I either received no response from the company or got a generic email saying that the vacancy was filled.Most recently, on March 16, I had an interview for the role of Curious Junior Mentor. The interview went well because I have 12 years of experience in the education sector, including 5 years in edtech. I have worked with Unacademy and BYJU'S, so I am well-versed in this industry.Coming back to the story, I had my second-round interview on March 18. That also went wellâ€”I provided a demo using a pen tab, and everything seemed to go smoothly. But then, as expected, there was no update or confirmation from their side. When I messaged the HR team today (March 21), I received the same generic response: "We did not find you fit for the role."So, to anyone who doesnâ€™t have connections within the HR or hiring teamâ€”please donâ€™t waste your time applying to Physics Wallah.And to the founders of the company, I sincerely request you to pay attention to this rigged hiring process.Abhishek Jain @Subhangi Arora shrankhla.paliwal@pw.livepayalparthiyal@pw.livenavya.sharma1@pw.live

Where the court confirmed that the delay fine is only due if the project is fully implemented with a delay in delivery, but in the case of a fundamental breach of implementation, whether by not completing the works or implementing only part of it, there is no place for the delay fine, but compensation is the legal solution, provided that the actual damage is proven.The court relied on Articles 272 and 389 of the UAE Civil Transactions Law, where the first requires damage to be achieved for the entitlement to compensation, while the second gives the court discretion to estimate its value according to the actual damage to the employer.This principle reinforces the contractual balance between the contracting parties, as it prevents the imposition of unjustified obligations on the contractor, while ensuring the protection of the employer's rights to compensation for damages caused to him as a result of a fundamental breach of execution.

If youâ€™re in the real estate or RWA space, this is your signal the future is already here.Whatâ€™s your take on this? Why are Indian millionaires leaving the country for places like the UAE and Singapore? It's a growing trend that needs attention.High taxes, complex regulations, and the lure of a better lifestyle are just a few reasons. Even the sons and relatives of politicians are making similar moves. Countries like the UAE offer tax-friendly policies and a seamless business environment, making relocation an easy choice.But when wealthy individuals leave, it impacts India's economy. Their investments, job creation, and contributions to the GDP are invaluable.Losing this capital affects our growth and innovation.The government should consider simplifying tax policies, improving business conditions, and enhancing the quality of life to retain talent and wealth.What are your thoughts?

SCAM ALERT ! PW (PhysicsWallah) Alakh Panday Alakh Pandey (PhysicsWallah) Alakh Pandey Scam alert ! Scam alert! Rigged Hiring ! Rigged HiringPW (PhysicsWallah) PW (PhysicsWallah) Physichswallah's hiring process is a fraud. Please don't waste your time applying for jobs here. The hiring at Physics Wallah is riggedâ€”no matter how talented you are or how strong your past work experience is, you wonâ€™t get the job. Jobs are only given to HR's relatives and acquaintances.In the past six months, I have applied for various job positions that perfectly matched my expertise. Yet, I either received no response from the company or got a generic email saying that the vacancy was filled.Most recently, on March 16, I had an interview for the role of Curious Junior Mentor. The interview went well because I have 12 years of experience in the education sector, including 5 years in edtech. I have worked with Unacademy and BYJU'S, so I am well-versed in this industry.Coming back to the story, I had my second-round interview on March 18. That also went wellâ€”I provided a demo using a pen tab, and everything seemed to go smoothly. But then, as expected, there was no update or confirmation from their side. When I messaged the HR team today (March 21), I received the same generic response: "We did not find you fit for the role."So, to anyone who doesnâ€™t have connections within the HR or hiring teamâ€”please donâ€™t waste your time applying to Physics Wallah.And to the founders of the company, I sincerely request you to pay attention to this rigged hiring process.Abhishek Jain @Subhangi Arora shrankhla.paliwal@pw.livepayalparthiyal@pw.livenavya.sharma1@pw.live

Where the court confirmed that the delay fine is only due if the project is fully implemented with a delay in delivery, but in the case of a fundamental breach of implementation, whether by not completing the works or implementing only part of it, there is no place for the delay fine, but compensation is the legal solution, provided that the actual damage is proven.The court relied on Articles 272 and 389 of the UAE Civil Transactions Law, where the first requires damage to be achieved for the entitlement to compensation, while the second gives the court discretion to estimate its value according to the actual damage to the employer.This principle reinforces the contractual balance between the contracting parties, as it prevents the imposition of unjustified obligations on the contractor, while ensuring the protection of the employer's rights to compensation for damages caused to him as a result of a fundamental breach of execution.

I don't see around anymore the bullish idea of "the biggest, the fastest" of few years ago but more of "a better".It is the world capital of marketing. Above anything hashtag#dubaichocolate maybe will fade by the summer. But FIX Dessert Chocolatier has entered by right in every business school case list. Never seen anything like this before in food, and leas originating from hashtag#Dubai.

Letâ€™s dive into Off-Plan vs Secondary investments.ğŸ—ï¸ Off-Plan (New Developments):ğŸ’° Lock in todayâ€™s price with flexible payment plans.ğŸ“ˆ Property appreciates by 30-40% by handover (usually 3 years).ğŸ“† After completion, it appreciates 7-10% annually.ğŸ’µ Start earning 7-8% rental yield once the property is ready.ğŸ¡ Secondary Market (Ready Properties):ğŸ’µ Immediate rental income (7% annual yield).ğŸ“‰ More stable, but lower capital appreciation (5-7% per year).ğŸ’¸ Higher upfront costs and possible maintenance expenses.ğŸ’¡ A Working Example: Off-Plan vs Secondary Scenario 1: Off-Plan Investment ($1M)âœ… $600K paid over 3 years (60% during construction).ğŸ’¥ Property value increases to $1.35M (35% rise) by completion.âœ… Final $400K payment upon handover.ğŸ“ˆ Post-handover, property appreciates 7-10% annually.After 7 years:ğŸ“Š Property Value: ~$1.9M - $2.3MğŸ’µ Total Rental Income (Years 4-7): ~$400KğŸ’¥ Total Value: $2.3M - $2.7M (2.3x-2.7x return) Scenario 2: Secondary Market ($1M Ready Property)âœ… 100% upfront payment.ğŸ’¸ Start earning $70K per year in rental income (7%).ğŸ“ˆ Property appreciates at 5-7% annually.After 7 years:ğŸ“Š Property Value: ~$1.4M - $1.6MğŸ’µ Total Rental Income: ~$490KğŸ’¥ Total Value: $1.9M - $2.1M (1.9x-2.1x return)ğŸ“Œ Key Takeaways:ğŸ”‘ Off-Plan requires less upfront capital (only 60% during construction).ğŸ“ˆ Off-Plan offers higher capital growth in the long run (up to 2.7x return vs 2.1x).ğŸ¡ Secondary provides immediate cash flow but lower appreciation.ğŸš€ The Winner?The Off-Plan investment grows faster, needs less upfront capital, and provides a higher-value asset once completed. If youâ€™re in the real estate or RWA space, this is your signal the future is already here.Whatâ€™s your take on this? Why are Indian millionaires leaving the country for places like the UAE and Singapore? It's a growing trend that needs attention.High taxes, complex regulations, and the lure of a better lifestyle are just a few reasons. Even the sons and relatives of politicians are making similar moves. Countries like the UAE offer tax-friendly policies and a seamless business environment, making relocation an easy choice.But when wealthy individuals leave, it impacts India's economy. Their investments, job creation, and contributions to the GDP are invaluable.Losing this capital affects our growth and innovation.The government should consider simplifying tax policies, improving business conditions, and enhancing the quality of life to retain talent and wealth.What are your thoughts?

SCAM ALERT ! PW (PhysicsWallah) Alakh Panday Alakh Pandey (PhysicsWallah) Alakh Pandey Scam alert ! Scam alert! Rigged Hiring ! Rigged HiringPW (PhysicsWallah) PW (PhysicsWallah) Physichswallah's hiring process is a fraud. Please don't waste your time applying for jobs here. The hiring at Physics Wallah is riggedâ€”no matter how talented you are or how strong your past work experience is, you wonâ€™t get the job. Jobs are only given to HR's relatives and acquaintances.In the past six months, I have applied for various job positions that perfectly matched my expertise. Yet, I either received no response from the company or got a generic email saying that the vacancy was filled.Most recently, on March 16, I had an interview for the role of Curious Junior Mentor. The interview went well because I have 12 years of experience in the education sector, including 5 years in edtech. I have worked with Unacademy and BYJU'S, so I am well-versed in this industry.Coming back to the story, I had my second-round interview on March 18. That also went wellâ€”I provided a demo using a pen tab, and everything seemed to go smoothly. But then, as expected, there was no update or confirmation from their side. When I messaged the HR team today (March 21), I received the same generic response: "We did not find you fit for the role."So, to anyone who doesnâ€™t have connections within the HR or hiring teamâ€”please donâ€™t waste your time applying to Physics Wallah.And to the founders of the company, I sincerely request you to pay attention to this rigged hiring process.Abhishek Jain @Subhangi Arora shrankhla.paliwal@pw.livepayalparthiyal@pw.livenavya.sharma1@pw.live

Hiring is broken. AI is not helping. When it comes to hiring next-level developers, how can you find the right people who will make a difference when you yourself are not a senior engineer? I mean, if you needed to send a team of astronauts into space for something that would save all humanity, who would you ask to help you put together that team of astronauts? A recruiter? No. Probably an ex-astronaut who knows to ask something lifesavingly relevant like â€œwhatâ€™s the meeting point of titanium?!â€ Ok maybe thatâ€™s all science fiction on my part. But the pain is real for both sides of the hiring equation.I feel very fortunate to have met this team I started working with recently: A team of three exceptional founders who have extensive experience in MAANG environments. If you or anyone you know are a Dev person getting ghosted by recruiters; or one who is transitioning to that next senior dream role, join the limited cohort. 7 Devs 3 SDETs â€” last I checked I think they only need 5 more Devs to kick off. Where the court confirmed that the delay fine is only due if the project is fully implemented with a delay in delivery, but in the case of a fundamental breach of implementation, whether by not completing the works or implementing only part of it, there is no place for the delay fine, but compensation is the legal solution, provided that the actual damage is proven.The court relied on Articles 272 and 389 of the UAE Civil Transactions Law, where the first requires damage to be achieved for the entitlement to compensation, while the second gives the court discretion to estimate its value according to the actual damage to the employer.This principle reinforces the contractual balance between the contracting parties, as it prevents the imposition of unjustified obligations on the contractor, while ensuring the protection of the employer's rights to compensation for damages caused to him as a result of a fundamental breach of execution.

If youâ€™re in the real estate or RWA space, this is your signal the future is already here.Whatâ€™s your take on this? Why are Indian millionaires leaving the country for places like the UAE and Singapore? It's a growing trend that needs attention.High taxes, complex regulations, and the lure of a better lifestyle are just a few reasons. Even the sons and relatives of politicians are making similar moves. Countries like the UAE offer tax-friendly policies and a seamless business environment, making relocation an easy choice.But when wealthy individuals leave, it impacts India's economy. Their investments, job creation, and contributions to the GDP are invaluable.Losing this capital affects our growth and innovation.The government should consider simplifying tax policies, improving business conditions, and enhancing the quality of life to retain talent and wealth.What are your thoughts?

SCAM ALERT ! PW (PhysicsWallah) Alakh Panday Alakh Pandey (PhysicsWallah) Alakh Pandey Scam alert ! Scam alert! Rigged Hiring ! Rigged HiringPW (PhysicsWallah) PW (PhysicsWallah) Physichswallah's hiring process is a fraud. Please don't waste your time applying for jobs here. The hiring at Physics Wallah is riggedâ€”no matter how talented you are or how strong your past work experience is, you wonâ€™t get the job. Jobs are only given to HR's relatives and acquaintances.In the past six months, I have applied for various job positions that perfectly matched my expertise. Yet, I either received no response from the company or got a generic email saying that the vacancy was filled.Most recently, on March 16, I had an interview for the role of Curious Junior Mentor. The interview went well because I have 12 years of experience in the education sector, including 5 years in edtech. I have worked with Unacademy and BYJU'S, so I am well-versed in this industry.Coming back to the story, I had my second-round interview on March 18. That also went wellâ€”I provided a demo using a pen tab, and everything seemed to go smoothly. But then, as expected, there was no update or confirmation from their side. When I messaged the HR team today (March 21), I received the same generic response: "We did not find you fit for the role."So, to anyone who doesnâ€™t have connections within the HR or hiring teamâ€”please donâ€™t waste your time applying to Physics Wallah.And to the founders of the company, I sincerely request you to pay attention to this rigged hiring process.Abhishek Jain @Subhangi Arora shrankhla.paliwal@pw.livepayalparthiyal@pw.livenavya.sharma1@pw.live

Hiring is broken. AI is not helping. When it comes to hiring next-level developers, how can you find the right people who will make a difference when you yourself are not a senior engineer? I mean, if you needed to send a team of astronauts into space for something that would save all humanity, who would you ask to help you put together that team of astronauts? A recruiter? No. Probably an ex-astronaut who knows to ask something lifesavingly relevant like â€œwhatâ€™s the meeting point of titanium?!â€ Ok maybe thatâ€™s all science fiction on my part. But the pain is real for both sides of the hiring equation.I feel very fortunate to have met this team I started working with recently: A team of three exceptional founders who have extensive experience in MAANG environments. If you or anyone you know are a Dev person getting ghosted by recruiters; or one who is transitioning to that next senior dream role, join the limited cohort. 7 Devs 3 SDETs â€” last I checked I think they only need 5 more Devs to kick off. Where the court confirmed that the delay fine is only due if the project is fully implemented with a delay in delivery, but in the case of a fundamental breach of implementation, whether by not completing the works or implementing only part of it, there is no place for the delay fine, but compensation is the legal solution, provided that the actual damage is proven.The court relied on Articles 272 and 389 of the UAE Civil Transactions Law, where the first requires damage to be achieved for the entitlement to compensation, while the second gives the court discretion to estimate its value according to the actual damage to the employer.This principle reinforces the contractual balance between the contracting parties, as it prevents the imposition of unjustified obligations on the contractor, while ensuring the protection of the employer's rights to compensation for damages caused to him as a result of a fundamental breach of execution.

If youâ€™re in the real estate or RWA space, this is your signal the future is already here.Whatâ€™s your take on this? Why are Indian millionaires leaving the country for places like the UAE and Singapore? It's a growing trend that needs attention.High taxes, complex regulations, and the lure of a better lifestyle are just a few reasons. Even the sons and relatives of politicians are making similar moves. Countries like the UAE offer tax-friendly policies and a seamless business environment, making relocation an easy choice.But when wealthy individuals leave, it impacts India's economy. Their investments, job creation, and contributions to the GDP are invaluable.Losing this capital affects our growth and innovation.The government should consider simplifying tax policies, improving business conditions, and enhancing the quality of life to retain talent and wealth.What are your thoughts?

SCAM ALERT ! PW (PhysicsWallah) Alakh Panday Alakh Pandey (PhysicsWallah) Alakh Pandey Scam alert ! Scam alert! Rigged Hiring ! Rigged HiringPW (PhysicsWallah) PW (PhysicsWallah) Physichswallah's hiring process is a fraud. Please don't waste your time applying for jobs here. The hiring at Physics Wallah is riggedâ€”no matter how talented you are or how strong your past work experience is, you wonâ€™t get the job. Jobs are only given to HR's relatives and acquaintances.In the past six months, I have applied for various job positions that perfectly matched my expertise. Yet, I either received no response from the company or got a generic email saying that the vacancy was filled.Most recently, on March 16, I had an interview for the role of Curious Junior Mentor. The interview went well because I have 12 years of experience in the education sector, including 5 years in edtech. I have worked with Unacademy and BYJU'S, so I am well-versed in this industry.Coming back to the story, I had my second-round interview on March 18. That also went wellâ€”I provided a demo using a pen tab, and everything seemed to go smoothly. But then, as expected, there was no update or confirmation from their side. When I messaged the HR team today (March 21), I received the same generic response: "We did not find you fit for the role."So, to anyone who doesnâ€™t have connections within the HR or hiring teamâ€”please donâ€™t waste your time applying to Physics Wallah.And to the founders of the company, I sincerely request you to pay attention to this rigged hiring process.Abhishek Jain @Subhangi Arora shrankhla.paliwal@pw.livepayalparthiyal@pw.livenavya.sharma1@pw.live

Hiring is broken. AI is not helping. When it comes to hiring next-level developers, how can you find the right people who will make a difference when you yourself are not a senior engineer? I mean, if you needed to send a team of astronauts into space for something that would save all humanity, who would you ask to help you put together that team of astronauts? A recruiter? No. Probably an ex-astronaut who knows to ask something lifesavingly relevant like â€œwhatâ€™s the meeting point of titanium?!â€ Ok maybe thatâ€™s all science fiction on my part. But the pain is real for both sides of the hiring equation.I feel very fortunate to have met this team I started working with recently: A team of three exceptional founders who have extensive experience in MAANG environments. If you or anyone you know are a Dev person getting ghosted by recruiters; or one who is transitioning to that next senior dream role, join the limited cohort. 7 Devs 3 SDETs â€” last I checked I think they only need 5 more Devs to kick off. I recently sat down with Enterprise to share my thoughts on the evolving business landscape in 2025 and beyond. In our discussion, we explored how businesses are adapting to rapid change - from interest rate dynamics to geopolitical shifts. I remain optimistic about the UAE's position in this changing landscape, particularly given its commitment to sound regulation, peace, and open trade relationships.On the technology front, I emphasized that the AI revolution is only just beginning to impact our lives. When you're at the cutting edge of AI and digitalization, consulting and tech firms can help in certain areas, but the real work of pioneering, implementing, and sustaining AI must be owned by the business itself. Where the court confirmed that the delay fine is only due if the project is fully implemented with a delay in delivery, but in the case of a fundamental breach of implementation, whether by not completing the works or implementing only part of it, there is no place for the delay fine, but compensation is the legal solution, provided that the actual damage is proven.The court relied on Articles 272 and 389 of the UAE Civil Transactions Law, where the first requires damage to be achieved for the entitlement to compensation, while the second gives the court discretion to estimate its value according to the actual damage to the employer.This principle reinforces the contractual balance between the contracting parties, as it prevents the imposition of unjustified obligations on the contractor, while ensuring the protection of the employer's rights to compensation for damages caused to him as a result of a fundamental breach of execution.

If youâ€™re in the real estate or RWA space, this is your signal the future is already here.Whatâ€™s your take on this? Why are Indian millionaires leaving the country for places like the UAE and Singapore? It's a growing trend that needs attention.High taxes, complex regulations, and the lure of a better lifestyle are just a few reasons. Even the sons and relatives of politicians are making similar moves. Countries like the UAE offer tax-friendly policies and a seamless business environment, making relocation an easy choice.But when wealthy individuals leave, it impacts India's economy. Their investments, job creation, and contributions to the GDP are invaluable.Losing this capital affects our growth and innovation.The government should consider simplifying tax policies, improving business conditions, and enhancing the quality of life to retain talent and wealth.What are your thoughts?

SCAM ALERT ! PW (PhysicsWallah) Alakh Panday Alakh Pandey (PhysicsWallah) Alakh Pandey Scam alert ! Scam alert! Rigged Hiring ! Rigged HiringPW (PhysicsWallah) PW (PhysicsWallah) Physichswallah's hiring process is a fraud. Please don't waste your time applying for jobs here. The hiring at Physics Wallah is riggedâ€”no matter how talented you are or how strong your past work experience is, you wonâ€™t get the job. Jobs are only given to HR's relatives and acquaintances.In the past six months, I have applied for various job positions that perfectly matched my expertise. Yet, I either received no response from the company or got a generic email saying that the vacancy was filled.Most recently, on March 16, I had an interview for the role of Curious Junior Mentor. The interview went well because I have 12 years of experience in the education sector, including 5 years in edtech. I have worked with Unacademy and BYJU'S, so I am well-versed in this industry.Coming back to the story, I had my second-round interview on March 18. That also went wellâ€”I provided a demo using a pen tab, and everything seemed to go smoothly. But then, as expected, there was no update or confirmation from their side. When I messaged the HR team today (March 21), I received the same generic response: "We did not find you fit for the role."So, to anyone who doesnâ€™t have connections within the HR or hiring teamâ€”please donâ€™t waste your time applying to Physics Wallah.And to the founders of the company, I sincerely request you to pay attention to this rigged hiring process.Abhishek Jain @Subhangi Arora shrankhla.paliwal@pw.livepayalparthiyal@pw.livenavya.sharma1@pw.live

Hiring is broken. AI is not helping. When it comes to hiring next-level developers, how can you find the right people who will make a difference when you yourself are not a senior engineer? I mean, if you needed to send a team of astronauts into space for something that would save all humanity, who would you ask to help you put together that team of astronauts? A recruiter? No. Probably an ex-astronaut who knows to ask something lifesavingly relevant like â€œwhatâ€™s the meeting point of titanium?!â€ Ok maybe thatâ€™s all science fiction on my part. But the pain is real for both sides of the hiring equation.I feel very fortunate to have met this team I started working with recently: A team of three exceptional founders who have extensive experience in MAANG environments. If you or anyone you know are a Dev person getting ghosted by recruiters; or one who is transitioning to that next senior dream role, join the limited cohort. 7 Devs 3 SDETs â€” last I checked I think they only need 5 more Devs to kick off. I recently sat down with Enterprise to share my thoughts on the evolving business landscape in 2025 and beyond. In our discussion, we explored how businesses are adapting to rapid change - from interest rate dynamics to geopolitical shifts. I remain optimistic about the UAE's position in this changing landscape, particularly given its commitment to sound regulation, peace, and open trade relationships.On the technology front, I emphasized that the AI revolution is only just beginning to impact our lives. When you're at the cutting edge of AI and digitalization, consulting and tech firms can help in certain areas, but the real work of pioneering, implementing, and sustaining AI must be owned by the business itself. ğŸ“¢ Key Court Ruling on Construction Dispute â€“ Abu Dhabi Court of CassationIn Case No. 2022-969-Commercial, the Abu Dhabi Court of Cassation issued a ruling regarding a contractual dispute over a construction project. The case revolved around delays in project completion, outstanding payments, and compliance with contractual obligations.ğŸ”¹ Key Takeaways from the Judgment: âœ… The court upheld the principle that a contractor is obligated to complete the project as per the agreed terms and timelines. âœ… Final settlement agreements, once signed by both parties, are legally binding and cannot be contested without valid grounds. âœ… The court increased the awarded compensation for project delays from AED 50,000 to AED 150,000, recognizing the financial impact of delayed handover. âœ… Claims for additional work must be supported by documented approvals from the employer or engineer.âš–ï¸ This ruling reinforces the importance of contractual adherence, timely project completion, and the legal enforceability of settlement agreements in construction disputes.hashtag#Law hashtag#UAE hashtag#ConstructionLaw hashtag#AbuDhabi

Where the court confirmed that the delay fine is only due if the project is fully implemented with a delay in delivery, but in the case of a fundamental breach of implementation, whether by not completing the works or implementing only part of it, there is no place for the delay fine, but compensation is the legal solution, provided that the actual damage is proven.The court relied on Articles 272 and 389 of the UAE Civil Transactions Law, where the first requires damage to be achieved for the entitlement to compensation, while the second gives the court discretion to estimate its value according to the actual damage to the employer.This principle reinforces the contractual balance between the contracting parties, as it prevents the imposition of unjustified obligations on the contractor, while ensuring the protection of the employer's rights to compensation for damages caused to him as a result of a fundamental breach of execution.

If youâ€™re in the real estate or RWA space, this is your signal the future is already here.Whatâ€™s your take on this? Why are Indian millionaires leaving the country for places like the UAE and Singapore? It's a growing trend that needs attention.High taxes, complex regulations, and the lure of a better lifestyle are just a few reasons. Even the sons and relatives of politicians are making similar moves. Countries like the UAE offer tax-friendly policies and a seamless business environment, making relocation an easy choice.But when wealthy individuals leave, it impacts India's economy. Their investments, job creation, and contributions to the GDP are invaluable.Losing this capital affects our growth and innovation.The government should consider simplifying tax policies, improving business conditions, and enhancing the quality of life to retain talent and wealth.What are your thoughts?

SCAM ALERT ! PW (PhysicsWallah) Alakh Panday Alakh Pandey (PhysicsWallah) Alakh Pandey Scam alert ! Scam alert! Rigged Hiring ! Rigged HiringPW (PhysicsWallah) PW (PhysicsWallah) Physichswallah's hiring process is a fraud. Please don't waste your time applying for jobs here. The hiring at Physics Wallah is riggedâ€”no matter how talented you are or how strong your past work experience is, you wonâ€™t get the job. Jobs are only given to HR's relatives and acquaintances.In the past six months, I have applied for various job positions that perfectly matched my expertise. Yet, I either received no response from the company or got a generic email saying that the vacancy was filled.Most recently, on March 16, I had an interview for the role of Curious Junior Mentor. The interview went well because I have 12 years of experience in the education sector, including 5 years in edtech. I have worked with Unacademy and BYJU'S, so I am well-versed in this industry.Coming back to the story, I had my second-round interview on March 18. That also went wellâ€”I provided a demo using a pen tab, and everything seemed to go smoothly. But then, as expected, there was no update or confirmation from their side. When I messaged the HR team today (March 21), I received the same generic response: "We did not find you fit for the role."So, to anyone who doesnâ€™t have connections within the HR or hiring teamâ€”please donâ€™t waste your time applying to Physics Wallah.And to the founders of the company, I sincerely request you to pay attention to this rigged hiring process.Abhishek Jain @Subhangi Arora shrankhla.paliwal@pw.livepayalparthiyal@pw.livenavya.sharma1@pw.live

Hiring is broken. AI is not helping. When it comes to hiring next-level developers, how can you find the right people who will make a difference when you yourself are not a senior engineer? I mean, if you needed to send a team of astronauts into space for something that would save all humanity, who would you ask to help you put together that team of astronauts? A recruiter? No. Probably an ex-astronaut who knows to ask something lifesavingly relevant like â€œwhatâ€™s the meeting point of titanium?!â€ Ok maybe thatâ€™s all science fiction on my part. But the pain is real for both sides of the hiring equation.I feel very fortunate to have met this team I started working with recently: A team of three exceptional founders who have extensive experience in MAANG environments. If you or anyone you know are a Dev person getting ghosted by recruiters; or one who is transitioning to that next senior dream role, join the limited cohort. 7 Devs 3 SDETs â€” last I checked I think they only need 5 more Devs to kick off. ğŸ“¢ Key Court Ruling on Construction Dispute â€“ Abu Dhabi Court of CassationIn Case No. 2022-969-Commercial, the Abu Dhabi Court of Cassation issued a ruling regarding a contractual dispute over a construction project. The case revolved around delays in project completion, outstanding payments, and compliance with contractual obligations.ğŸ”¹ Key Takeaways from the Judgment: âœ… The court upheld the principle that a contractor is obligated to complete the project as per the agreed terms and timelines. âœ… Final settlement agreements, once signed by both parties, are legally binding and cannot be contested without valid grounds. âœ… The court increased the awarded compensation for project delays from AED 50,000 to AED 150,000, recognizing the financial impact of delayed handover. âœ… Claims for additional work must be supported by documented approvals from the employer or engineer.âš–ï¸ This ruling reinforces the importance of contractual adherence, timely project completion, and the legal enforceability of settlement agreements in construction disputes.hashtag#Law hashtag#UAE hashtag#ConstructionLaw hashtag#AbuDhabi

Where the court confirmed that the delay fine is only due if the project is fully implemented with a delay in delivery, but in the case of a fundamental breach of implementation, whether by not completing the works or implementing only part of it, there is no place for the delay fine, but compensation is the legal solution, provided that the actual damage is proven.The court relied on Articles 272 and 389 of the UAE Civil Transactions Law, where the first requires damage to be achieved for the entitlement to compensation, while the second gives the court discretion to estimate its value according to the actual damage to the employer.This principle reinforces the contractual balance between the contracting parties, as it prevents the imposition of unjustified obligations on the contractor, while ensuring the protection of the employer's rights to compensation for damages caused to him as a result of a fundamental breach of execution.

Dubai Financial Services Authority Launches Tokenization RegulatoryDubai will always be known for its ability to adapt and adopt great innovations to enable them to move forward.And if you ask me, I'd say they made the right choice giving tokenization a chance to change things around the real estate industry in Dubai.Having experience working with a few real estate professionals in Dubai, I know this will go a long way for them.The Dubai Land Department (DLD) just launched a Real Estate Tokenization Pilot Program, making it the first real estate registry department in the Middle East to regulate ownership titles on a blockchain.By 2033, DLD expects tokenized real estate to account for 7% of all property transactions in Dubai â€” thatâ€™s 60 billion dirhams ($16B) in tokenized property deals.This move isnâ€™t just about tokenization, itâ€™s about unlocking new market opportunities: âœ… Lower barriers to entry for investors âœ… Increased liquidity and faster settlements âœ… Transparent ownership backed by blockchainUnlike traditional real estate models, tokenization creates a structured ownership system â€” giving investors more control and security.Marwan Ahmed Bin Ghalita, Director General of DLD, put it perfectly: "This initiative will simplify and enhance buying, selling, and investment processes."Dubai is once again showing why itâ€™s a global leader in innovation. If youâ€™re in the real estate or RWA space, this is your signal the future is already here.Whatâ€™s your take on this? Are we about to see a major shift in real estate investment? ğŸ‘‡if you enjoy this post; like, comment, and share to spread the word!

Why are Indian millionaires leaving the country for places like the UAE and Singapore? It's a growing trend that needs attention.High taxes, complex regulations, and the lure of a better lifestyle are just a few reasons. Even the sons and relatives of politicians are making similar moves. Countries like the UAE offer tax-friendly policies and a seamless business environment, making relocation an easy choice.But when wealthy individuals leave, it impacts India's economy. Their investments, job creation, and contributions to the GDP are invaluable.Losing this capital affects our growth and innovation.The government should consider simplifying tax policies, improving business conditions, and enhancing the quality of life to retain talent and wealth.What are your thoughts?

SCAM ALERT ! PW (PhysicsWallah) Alakh Panday Alakh Pandey (PhysicsWallah) Alakh Pandey Scam alert ! Scam alert! Rigged Hiring ! Rigged HiringPW (PhysicsWallah) PW (PhysicsWallah) Physichswallah's hiring process is a fraud. Please don't waste your time applying for jobs here. The hiring at Physics Wallah is riggedâ€”no matter how talented you are or how strong your past work experience is, you wonâ€™t get the job. Jobs are only given to HR's relatives and acquaintances.In the past six months, I have applied for various job positions that perfectly matched my expertise. Yet, I either received no response from the company or got a generic email saying that the vacancy was filled.Most recently, on March 16, I had an interview for the role of Curious Junior Mentor. The interview went well because I have 12 years of experience in the education sector, including 5 years in edtech. I have worked with Unacademy and BYJU'S, so I am well-versed in this industry.Coming back to the story, I had my second-round interview on March 18. That also went wellâ€”I provided a demo using a pen tab, and everything seemed to go smoothly. But then, as expected, there was no update or confirmation from their side. When I messaged the HR team today (March 21), I received the same generic response: "We did not find you fit for the role."So, to anyone who doesnâ€™t have connections within the HR or hiring teamâ€”please donâ€™t waste your time applying to Physics Wallah.And to the founders of the company, I sincerely request you to pay attention to this rigged hiring process.Abhishek Jain @Subhangi Arora shrankhla.paliwal@pw.livepayalparthiyal@pw.livenavya.sharma1@pw.live

Hiring is broken. AI is not helping. When it comes to hiring next-level developers, how can you find the right people who will make a difference when you yourself are not a senior engineer? I mean, if you needed to send a team of astronauts into space for something that would save all humanity, who would you ask to help you put together that team of astronauts? A recruiter? No. Probably an ex-astronaut who knows to ask something lifesavingly relevant like â€œwhatâ€™s the meeting point of titanium?!â€ Ok maybe thatâ€™s all science fiction on my part. But the pain is real for both sides of the hiring equation.I feel very fortunate to have met this team I started working with recently: A team of three exceptional founders who have extensive experience in MAANG environments. If you or anyone you know are a Dev person getting ghosted by recruiters; or one who is transitioning to that next senior dream role, join the limited cohort. 7 Devs 3 SDETs â€” last I checked I think they only need 5 more Devs to kick off. ğŸ“¢ Key Court Ruling on Construction Dispute â€“ Abu Dhabi Court of CassationIn Case No. 2022-969-Commercial, the Abu Dhabi Court of Cassation issued a ruling regarding a contractual dispute over a construction project. The case revolved around delays in project completion, outstanding payments, and compliance with contractual obligations.ğŸ”¹ Key Takeaways from the Judgment: âœ… The court upheld the principle that a contractor is obligated to complete the project as per the agreed terms and timelines. âœ… Final settlement agreements, once signed by both parties, are legally binding and cannot be contested without valid grounds. âœ… The court increased the awarded compensation for project delays from AED 50,000 to AED 150,000, recognizing the financial impact of delayed handover. âœ… Claims for additional work must be supported by documented approvals from the employer or engineer.âš–ï¸ This ruling reinforces the importance of contractual adherence, timely project completion, and the legal enforceability of settlement agreements in construction disputes.hashtag#Law hashtag#UAE hashtag#ConstructionLaw hashtag#AbuDhabi
